results.title: Mr Shepard & Mr Milne = Mr Shepard and Mr Milne
results.creator_credit: Andrew Holmes, Andrew Holmes Productions, Weston Woods Studios and E.P. Dutton
results.brief_description: This film recreates the book world of Winnie the Pooh and the two men who gave it life. Illustrator Ernest Shepard reminisces about his collaboration with writer A.A. Milne on four books between the years 1923-1928, including “When we were very young”, “Winnie-the-Pooh”, “The House at Pooh Corner”, and “Now we are six”. Cast includes David Horovitch as the young Ernest Shepard and Richard Kay as A.A. Milne.

results.title: Mr Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Edward Sutherland, Douglas Fairbanks and Elton Corporation
results.brief_description: A rich playboy makes a bet that he can live on a desert island for a year without the luxuries of modern life. A satire of the classic novel by Daniel Defoe filmed on location on a Tahitian Island with Douglas Fairbanks playing an acrobatic Crusoe. Cast also includes William Farnum, Earle Browne and Maria Alba.

results.title: Mr Reliable: a true story
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Michael Hamlyn, Terry Hayes, Jim McElroy, State of Queensland, Hayes McElroy Productions, PolyGram Filmproduktion and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: In 1968, petty criminal Wally Melish (Colin Friels), earns himself the reputation of folk hero when he finds himself embroiled in an eight day siege with his girlfriend Beryl (Jacqueline McKenzie), after the police mistakenly think he has taken her hostage. The siege is marked by a marriage (between Wally and Beryl), and the media circus which captures the days events on national television. Based on a real event, cast includes Geoff Merrell, Neil Fitzpatrick, Lisa Hensley, Barry Otto and Paul Sonkkila.

results.title: Mr Prokouk becomes an inventor
results.brief_description: Mr Prokouk works in a menial repetitive job. Hunched over, uncomfortable, he decides to invent some apparatus to raise his drilling machine to his height. While at the drawing board he falls asleep and dreams that he is a successful inventor with thousands of patents to his name. He awakes and rushes to borrow books on patents. He then uses the books to elevate his machine. Animated film.

results.title: Mr Pickwick's dilemma from 'Pickwick Papers'
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis, Dickension Society, London and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”
An amusing episode in which Mr Pickwidk stumbles into the wrong bedroom, is challenged to a duel, and then arrested. He extricates himseslf with the aid of that remarkable man-servant, Sam Weller. From the Charles Dickens story, “The Pickwick Papers”.

results.title: Mr Nobody
results.creator_credit: Lyn Wright, Silva Basmajian, John Spotton and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Jack Huggins is sixty-five years old. He doesn’t take very good care of himself, but he lavishes attention on his menagerie of cats. He repairs and hoards electronic equipment he has picked from the garbage. When Jack did not comply with a Health Department order to clean up, he was forcefully removed from his home, certified incompetent, and the Public Trustee took charge of his affairs. Jack felt that he was being treated “like Mr. Nobody. Just Mr. Nobody out on the street.” This film will provoke the discussion of legal and ethical dilemmas concerning the self-neglecting elderly. Do mentally competent elders have the right to neglect themselves? Does the state have an obligation to intervene?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn Wright, Silva Basmajian, John Spotton and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Mr Money
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
A gentleman traveller with a capitalistic spirit lays waste to the world around him. This orgy of progress concludes when the Gentleman becomes that which he once conquered.
